header.title: A Course In Astral Travel - WEEK 5: Dealing with Negative Entities

central_thesis: The document asserts the existence of negative entities on the Astral and Mental planes, which actively hinder spiritual awakening and esoteric development. It prescribes specific magical conjurations and protective rituals as operative means to repel and neutralize these entities, thereby safeguarding practitioners during astral travel, dream work, and daily life.

structure_content.summary: Introduces the concept of duality as fundamental to existence and spiritual growth, positing that negative entities are beings who have 'awakened in evil' from human form, residing in higher dimensions (Fifth Dimension, Astral/Mental planes) to actively obstruct spiritual awakening and esoteric work.

structure_content.chapter_title: Impact and Deception of Negative Entities
structure_content.summary: Details the harmful effects of negative entities, including frightening practitioners back to the physical body, distracting from spiritual pursuits, inflaming egos and desires, darkening the Astral plane, and physically obstructing the rise of Kundalini. They employ deceit, appearing as benevolent guides to mislead or stop progress.

Recounts a personal experience with two deceptive individuals claiming advanced astral powers, who were later revealed to be negative entities attempting to block the author's Kundalini. This highlights the insidious nature of these beings and the need for discernment, especially through 'conjuration' when doubt arises.

Presents 'conjurations' as powerful verbal formulas to dispel or disable evil entities. Emphasizes the necessity of strong conviction and personal energy for their efficacy, recommending their use in the Astral, dreams, or physical sensing of negative presence.

Provides detailed instructions for the 'Jupiter' conjuration: placing the left hand on the solar plexus for protection, forming the right hand into a 'gun' gesture, pointing, and repeating 'In the Name of Jupiter, Father of Gods, I conjure you, Te Vigos Cosilim' three times. Notes visible energetic rays in the Astral.

Outlines the 'Bellilin' conjuration as a chanted formula, requiring no specific hand gestures, particularly useful when physical movement is restricted. The words 'Bellilin Bellilin Bellilin, Amphora of salvation, I would like to be next to you, Materialism has no strength next to me, Bellilin Bellilin Bellilin' are to be sung three times.

Introduces the 'Circle of Protection' as a magical barrier against evil entities, created through imaginative visualization and invocation of nature's elementals. This ritual safeguards a chosen area or individual, remaining active until physically broken.

Instructs on creating the circle by stating 'My father please, order my elemental intercessor to wrap a magical circle of protection around me (or the bed or the room, whatever), so that no evil entity can harm me' three times, while simultaneously visualizing a complete circle of light forming around the target.

Assigns practical exercises including consistent practice of conjurations and the circle of protection for subconscious integration, continued Astral Projection techniques using Mantras and visualization, and 'waking up in dreams' through reality questioning and daily awareness practices.

structure_content.chapter_title: Questions and Answers on Entity Dynamics and Practices
structure_content.summary: Addresses common queries regarding the meaning of esoteric terms ('Amphora', 'Te Vigos Cosilim'), the efficacy of invoking 'Jesus' versus prescribed conjurations, the origins of negative entities (including 'larvae' from human actions and 'egos' from subconscious), and the universal applicability of protective measures across planes and for others.

key_concepts.definition: Beings who have 'awakened in evil' from human form, residing primarily in the Astral and Mental planes (Fifth Dimension) but originating from inferior dimensions. Their purpose is to hinder spiritual progress, distract, inflate egos, and block the Kundalini. They often use deception, appearing as spiritual guides or frightening figures, and can manifest as demons or animals.

Specific verbal formulas, pronounced with strong conviction and energy, that possess the power to banish, disable, or return negative entities to their 'abode'. Examples include 'Jupiter' and 'Bellilin', which are operative tools for spiritual self-defense.

A protective ritual involving placing the left hand over the solar plexus and making a 'gun-shaped' gesture with the right hand, pointing towards the entity, while repeating 'In the Name of Jupiter, Father of Gods, I conjure you, Te Vigos Cosilim' three times. It is noted to project energetic rays in the Astral.

A chanted protective ritual, particularly useful when physical movement is restricted (e.g., during sleep paralysis). It involves singing 'Bellilin Bellilin Bellilin, Amphora of salvation, I would like to be next to you, Materialism has no strength next to me, Bellilin Bellilin Bellilin' three times. Bellilin is associated with a wind that casts away evil in Hindu traditions.

A magical barrier created through imagination and the invocation of an 'elemental intercessor'. It is formed by visualizing a complete circle of light while stating a specific intention ('My father please, order my elemental intercessor to wrap a magical circle of protection around me...'). This ritual, repeated three times, prevents negative entities from entering the protected space or harming those within.

The out-of-body experience where one's consciousness, or astral body, travels outside the physical form. The text highlights it as a crucial aspect of esoteric work and emphasizes the need for protection against entities encountered in this dimension.

An 'essential aspect of the spiritual path', often depicted as a coiled serpent energy at the base of the spine, whose ascent through the chakras is vital for spiritual awakening. Negative entities can actively work to block its rise, rendering the body 'useless for Esoteric work'.

Elements of the subconscious mind, such as anger, pride, and fear, that affect the astral body. These 'darkness within' must be overcome for spiritual transformation and can be symbolized by attacking animals in the astral.

Entities created by human negative habits and emotions, such as anger, drunkenness, or sexual desires (incubus/succubus). They harm the astral body and have a parasitic existence, requiring specific 'alchemical work' for their destruction.

practical_system.description: The system offers a comprehensive framework for spiritual self-defense, integrating verbal incantations (conjurations), specific physical gestures, and mental visualizations (circle of protection). Its core mechanism is based on the premise that spoken words, focused intent, and energetic seals can effectively repel or neutralize negative entities encountered during states of altered consciousness (astral travel, dreams) and in the physical plane. The practices are designed to be operative, requiring conscious engagement, strong conviction, and consistent repetition to achieve efficacy and integrate into the practitioner's subconscious for automatic defense.
tools: Solar plexus (as a protective focus for Jupiter Conjuration)
Right hand (for the 'gun-shaped' gesture in Jupiter Conjuration)
Imagination/Visualization (for rays during conjurations, and creating the Circle of Protection)
Mantras (specific vocalizations for astral projection and dream recall)
Elemental intercessor (invoked during the Circle of Protection ritual)
Intuition (for discerning the true nature of encountered entities)
Concentration/Conviction (as inherent energetic components for ritual efficacy)
rituals: Jupiter Conjuration: Left hand on solar plexus, right hand in 'gun' gesture, point and say 'In the Name of Jupiter, Father of Gods, I conjure you, Te Vigos Cosilim' three times.

Bellilin Conjuration: Chant 'Bellilin Bellilin Bellilin, Amphora of salvation, I would like to be next to you, Materialism has no strength next to me, Bellilin Bellilin Bellilin' three times (no specific hand gesture).

Circle of Protection: Verbally invoke 'My father please, order my elemental intercessor to wrap a magical circle of protection around me (or the bed or the room, whatever), so that no evil entity can harm me' three times, while visualizing a complete circle of light.
Astral Projection: Utilize specific Mantras (e.g., 'FaRaOn', 'Raom Gaom') and sustained visualization techniques.
Dream Awareness: Practice 'questioning where you are' (e.g., jump test, finger pull test) and daily 'awareness' exercises (e.g., washing, putting on shoes, eating) to cultivate lucidity in dreams.

relevant_quotes.text: It is the struggle against the darkness that makes us strong and gives us knowledge.
Just as there are divine spiritual beings, so too there are beings who are the opposite, negative beings.
They do not so much as cause harm physically as harm someones spiritual development.
Conjurations... have the power to return negative entities back to their abode or to disable them.

If for any reason you come across something and you are not sure whether it is from the good side or from the evil side; use a conjuration to check, if it's good it will stay, if it's bad, it will usually go, or be disabled.
The more we progress spiritually; the more the negative entities attack us and try to stop us.
If you stick to the rigid confines of a religion you will not be able to progress esoterically.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant for practitioners of operative esotericism and occultism, particularly those engaged in astral projection, lucidity practices, and spiritual development. It directly addresses common challenges and fears associated with navigating the subtle planes, providing explicit, practical magical techniques for protection. The text frames astral experiences within a dualistic cosmological model, where unseen forces actively oppose spiritual progress, necessitating robust magical self-defense. This protective framework is foundational for more advanced magical work and aligns with the pragmatic, operative focus of many grimoire traditions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of individuals actively involved in or aspiring to engage with astral projection, dream work, and broader esoteric or occult self-development. It caters to those seeking practical, actionable methods to deal with perceived negative spiritual influences. The text assumes a certain level of engagement with spiritual disciplines and a willingness to perform specific magical rituals, positioning itself as a manual for the aspiring 'esotericist' or 'magician' rather than a theoretical exposition.
